basics.name: Steven Edouard
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am a developer advocate at heart and engineer by trade. Solving real problems for individuals and organizations is my passion. I hope to pursue a role where I can have high impact on SaaS products and developers worldwide.

profiles.username: This Resume is built from this Github Repo

work.summary: A hybrid cloud savings platform that enables system administrators to save on their Virtual Machine IaaS costs through unique automations.
highlights: Created a hybrid SaaS product that integrated to 3 different Cloud IaaS Platforms (AWS, GCE, Azure)
Drove sales and marketing efforts resulting in the integration of $150,000/year in IaaS Virtual Machines from users in 15 countries
Saved tens of thousands of dollars (USD) in annual cloud cost
Leveraged relevant data technologies such as Elasticsearch, Redis, MongoDB and queue messaging
Built with RESTful, JSON-API compliant, APIs (via Node.js) with Ember.js frontend and docker-based background micro-services
Utilized best practices such as modularized design, unit testing, CI/CD and Staging/Production deployments

work.summary: Within Microsoftâ€™s Technical Evangelism and Development team, I developed exclusively open source solutions with partners and customers to make integrating with Microsoft technology easy.
highlights: Enabled Cloud Foundry support on Azure through open source collaboration which enabled millions in cloud spend
Built an open source cloud storage explorer which formed the base of the Microsoft's official cross-platform explorer for Azure
Contributed code to open source projects like Deis, Dokku and Meteor to run on Azure and Windows
Wrote 9 case studies evangelizing collaboration with partners and open source projects
Built CI pipelines, two of which are used by Azure Engineering and Cloud Foundry
Presented at various events around the world with topics ranging from DevOps to Web Development

work.summary: Responsible for increasing adoption of Microsoft developer platforms.
highlights: Built autonomous robotic T-Shirt cannon utilizing Kinect v2 sensor which was featured on Tech Crunch
Worked with various Y-Combinator startups to bring Linux workloads to Azure
Delivered Technical Presentations at Various conferences such as TC Disrupt SF, NodeConf Oakland, Stanford & Berkeley Hackathons
Created various technical content centered around open source on Azure such as blog posts and technical videos
Drove Azure usage by Student and Startup Developers

work.position: Software Development Engineer in Test, Common Language Runtime
work.summary: Responsible for integration, dynamic testing and diagnostics of the Common Language Runtime.
highlights: Created innovative test validations and infrastructure for Microsoft .NET Runtime debugger and diagnostics APIs consumed by Visual Studio
Extended Visual Studio Test Explorer it to run complex end-to-end scenario tests
Assisted in customer on-boarding to .NET 4.5.1 by syncing with feature teams to diagnose issues
Drove product test results and collaborated with various feature teams across .NET to drive validation pass rates

work.summary: Obtained critical experience during college on software development for mission-critical scenarios.
highlights: Designed system requirements for autonomous underwater vehicle
Designed and implemented features on common software for use with multiple vehicles
Performed software cost estimates
Implemented software features for sonar system displays

volunteer.summary: High school Teacher for an inner-city computer science class.
highlights: Featured in the International New York Times
